Description: Heavily corroded copper alloy nail-head or shank button (?), in the form of a small disc decorated on top with three concentric ridges; a rectangular trace in the middle of the underside indicates where was welded the shank or an eyelet.
Curator's comments: Very probably one of the bronze "nail-heads", with "concentric circles", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.80, p.186, pl.28)
